mim.author: ETXJOTJ
mim.name: RcsTimeM
mim.description: The fragment contains the System time management attributes.

derivedDataType.name: DifferenceFromUTC
derivedDataType.description:
Time zone difference between the local current time and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The format is as follows: [+/-]hh:mm
It is expressed as positive (that is, with the leading plus sign [+]) if the local time is ahead of or equal to UTC of day and as negative (that is, with the leading minus sign [-]) if it is behind the UTC of day. Example: +01:00

derivedDataType.name: DateTime
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the international standard for the representation of date and time ( ISO 8601). The string format is "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ" (excluding quotes). A DateTime string consists of a date part, a time part, and an optional time zone information part. The time zone part may be a "Z", representing the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone (equals to +00) or a time zone offset (for example, +02:00). If the time zone part is not present, the DateTime value represents local time.
The following pattern describes the DateTime format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.S+][Z|+-hh:mm] Where: YYYY = Four digit year MM = Two digit month (01=January, and so on) DD = Two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = Time designator (shows start of time component) hh = Two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = Two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = Two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) S+ = One or more digits of decimal fraction of a second Z = Time is UTC +- = + or - character indicating positive or negative offset to UTC
DateTime values are compliant with ISO 8601 "Representation of dates and times" but are restricted according to RFC 3339 "Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps". The DateTime format is further restricted as follows: - T and Z designators are upper case. - . (dot) is used to indicate start of fractions of seconds (ISO 8601 also allows comma)

class.name: TimeM
class.description: Time management concerns the calendar date and local time of the node.

attribute.name: timeMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying this MO.

class.name: DateAndTime
class.description: Local time and time zone values.

attribute.name: dateAndTimeId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying this MO.

attribute.name: timeZone
attribute.description:
The timezone of the ME.
A timezone is a region that has a uniform standard time. The string must match an entry in the ME's time zone database, for example 'Europe/Stockholm'.

attribute.name: localDateTime
attribute.description:
The local date and time of the ME.
Local time is standard time in a timezone at a fixed offset from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), possibly adjusted by Daylight Saving Time (DST) during part of the year.

attribute.name: dateTimeOffset
attribute.description: The offset in hours and minutes from UTC to local time.

attribute.name: tzRevision
attribute.description: The revision of the timezone database stored on the ME. If no timezone database is installed, the value of the attribute timeZone does not affect system time.
